summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 8624, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of East John Street, in the City of Seattle, from Belmont Avenue North to Boylston Avenue North, and Boylston Avenue North, from East John Street to East Denny Way, by grading and curbing the same, under Resolution number 265, of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said City, approved December 6, 1899.
